requestRandomness(bytes32,uint256,uint25.details: The source of the seed data must be something which the oraclecannot anticipate. See "SECURITY CONSIDERATIONS" above.The fulfillRandomness method receives the output, once it's providedby the Oracle, and verified by the vrfCoordinator.The _keyHash must already be registered with the VRFCoordinator, andthe _fee must exceed the fee specified during registration of the_keyHash.The returned requestId can be used to distinguish responses to *concurrent requests. It is passed as the first argument tofulfillRandomness.

params._fee: The amount of LINK to send with the request
params._keyHash: ID of public key against which randomness is generated
params._seed: Random seed from which output randomness is determined

returns.requestId: which will be returned with the response to this request

requestRandomness(bytes32,uint256,uint25.notice: requestRandomness initiates a request for VRF output given _seed
